title: Ticket #3087: DAGMan on NFS problems
description:
Message on condor-staff: 

Hi,

For the OSG User school, we wanted the students to work out of NFS. I remembered that DAGMan may not work well when the job log files are on NFS. I talked it over with Todd, and he reminded me that this problem has been addressed because of CREATE_LOCKS_ON_LOCAL_DISK.

http://research.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.8/3_3Configuration.html#param:NewLocking

Rock on! We can use DAGMan when submitting from NFS. This is great, and it worked well for the school.

Three things surprised me. Two are documentation issues (Karen) and one may be a problem with a d default configuration setting:

1. The documentation for CREATE_LOCKS_ON_LOCAL_DISK says:
When True, job user logs and the global job event log are written to a directory named condorLocks

That's not true, is it? The logs are still written where the user specified them, but the locks for those files are written on local disk, right?

2. The documentation for DAGMan says:

http://research.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.8/2_10DAGMan_Applications.html#4668
Log files for node jobs should not be placed on NFS. NFS file locking is not reliable, occasionally resulting in simultaneous acquisition of locks on a single log file by both the condor_schedd daemon and thecondor_dagman job.

By default, this isn't true anymore, right? At least on Unix, it's only true if someone disables CREATE_LOCKS_ON_LOCAL_DISK. I think this should be clarified

3. The default for DAGMAN_LOG_ON_NFS_IS_ERROR is True which causes errors when I submit from NFS, even if CREATE_LOCKS_ON_LOCAL_DISK is True. This is broken, right? I shouldn't be getting an error if I'm putting locks on local disk, right?

-alain
remarks:

Would a solution be to remove DAGMAN_LOG_ON_NFS_IS_ERROR entirely?

2012-Jun-28 22:01:28 by nwp:
I wrote a patch for this, but I am a bit unclear on what the solution is.
  • Is locking on NFS reliable now? In which case we can remove the check entirely.
  • Is it reliable only if CREATE_LOCKS_ON_LOCAL_DISK is True?
  • Is logging on NFS unreliable if ENABLE_USERLOG_LOCKING is set to False?
  • Is logging on NFS unreliable if ENABLE_USERLOG_LOCKING is set to True and CREATE_LOCKS_ON_LOCAL_DISK is False?
